snippet: How dare the French and Greeks reject a failed strategy!
abstract: Paul Krugman Op-Ed column asserts that French and Greek voters, by turning out incumbents, have rejected the failed austerity strategy; contends that because Pres Nicolas Sarkozy will not be around to offer unquestioning support to Germany, the main proponent and architect of austerity, the euro and the European project have a better chance of surviving than they did before the elections. (M)
lead_paragraph: The French are revolting. The Greeks, too. And it's about time. Both countries held elections Sunday that were in effect referendums on the current European economic strategy, and in both countries voters turned two thumbs down. It's far from clear how soon the votes will lead to changes in actual policy, but time is clearly running out for the strategy of recovery through austerity -- and that's a good thing.
